q: Analyze the below puzzle and guess the value of X?

If you are allowed to shift a word without disturbing other words, then determine the number of such shifts that is required to make the following sentence appropriate:

Minimum number of worthwhile people do anything before it becomes worthless to do it
Which of the following adjectives can be used with uncountable nouns?

Identify the prepositional phrase in the following sentence:

She handed the phone over to her brother for safekeeping before stepping out to dance in the rain.

Which of these correctly justifies the reason for the following sentence to be incorrect:

Mrs. Curry makes really nice pancakes.

a.option: Mrs. is not allowed and Missus must be used

q:
Select the correct option:

I have ________________ in a hammock before.

Which of these is an appropriate introductory verb that must be used in the following statement:

Alice _________ Pete to enroll in the university's Debate Society.

Determine the minimum number of words (no punctuations must be used) that must be included with the following words to create two appropriate sentences:

  1. Is
  2. Great
  3. Life

Which of these is the most appropriate pronoun to complete the following conversations:

Conversation 1

John: "Who is on the door?"
Alice: "It is ___."

Conversation 2

Bob: "Your team has a flight to catch tomorrow."
Lisa: "Please remind him or ___."

You are at the gym and need to describe the amount of time that you have already spent here to a friend who has just arrived at the gym. It is almost 8 PM and you have been at the gym since 6 PM. Which of the following sentences correctly describes this situation to your friend?

a.option: I will have worked out for two hours by the time it is 8 PM.
I have worked out for two hours by the time it is 8 PM.
I had worked out for two hours by the time it is 8 PM.
I will have been working out for two hours by the time it is 8 PM.

q: Which of the following sentences represents the correct usage of the future perfect continuous tense?

a.option: By the time it is 6, I will have been playing for three hours.
By the time it is November, I will have been working for three years.
On Thursday, I will have been waiting for three days for my results.
On Thursday, I will have been knowing you for ten days.

q:
Which of these sequences is correct in order to use the provided adjective for the following sentence:

She was a ________________, ________________ woman with a _____________ that only made her more attractive.

  1. Slender
  2. Young
  3. Dusky complexion

In the following sentence, since is used as conjunction denoting time. Which of these tenses must be used to include the verb:

I have not met him since I left school.

Which of the following words must be used at the end of the following sentence instead of ice so that the article inserted in the blank becomes an indefinite article:

Give me ___________ ice

If you are converting the following sentence to its indirect form, then which of the following types of tenses is used in the indirect sentence:

"I have been to the water world", he said.

Which of the following statements represents the correct indirect form of the following sentence:

Peter will arrive now.

a.option: He said that peter will arrive now
He said that peter would have arrived then
He said that peter would arrive then
He said that peter would be arriving then

q:
Which of these statements represents the correct indirect form of the following sentence:

Come to my place tomorrow.

a.option: Tom asked me to come to his place tomorrow.
Tom asked me to go to his place tomorrow.
Tom asked me to go to his place the next day.
Tom asked me to come to his place the next day.

q:
Which of these statements represents the correct indirect form of the following sentence:

How would this be converted to indirect form?

a.option: He said that these eggs need to go.
He said that these eggs needed to go.
He said that those eggs need to go.
He said that those eggs needed to go.

q:
Which of the following words is suitable to use in the following sentence:

Do not forget ---------- who brought this company this far.
You and John are classmates. You went to his house to get some help with a project. On knocking at his door, his mom opened the gate. Which of the following statements is incorrect in this condition?

a.option: I am a classmate of John
John is a classmate of mine.
I am one of John's classmates.

q: Which of the following represents the correct sequence of word order in a sentence?
John asks Alice if he can borrow her book. Assuming that Alice brought the book an hour before, which of the following responses is appropriate in this condition?

a.option: Alice: "No, I did not read it yet."
Alice: "No, I have not read it yet."
Alice: "No. I had not read it yet."
Alice: "No. I did not reading it yet"

q: Which of the following subjects contains the same possessive adjective and possessive pronoun?

Which of these is the most appropriate indirect speech of the following sentence: 

The accused said to the judge, “Let me fulfill my last wish before I die, Sir."

a.option: The accused begged the judge to allow him to fulfill his last wish before he died.
The accused told the judge to allow him to fulfill his last wish before he died.
The accused pleaded the judge to fulfill his last wish before he died.

q:
If the statement is converted from direct to indirect speech, then how many introductory verbs are required:

Linda said, 'I cannot understand this concept, teacher. Please assist me.'.

If the following sentence is converted to its reported speech, then which of these introductory verbs is the most suitable to use:

John said to his manager, 'I can't finish all of the work by myself!'.

Which of the following is the most appropriate reported speech for the following sentence:

Mr. Johnson said to Maria, 'Didn't you pay attention to what I taught? You must keep quiet when I teach.'.

a.option: Mr. Johnson asked Helen if she had paid attention to what he had taught or not, and added that she must be quiet when he taught.
Mr. Johnson asked Helen if she paid attention to what he taught or not, and added that she must be quiet when he taught.
Mr. Johnson asked Helen if she did not pay attention to what he taught or not, and added that she should be quiet when he teaches.

q:
Are the following clauses dependent or independent:

  1. Whenever I have the cash.
  2. There could be a solution.
  3. She studied in Starbucks for her math quiz.

Select the correct option:

___________________________ cooking, studying, and working, I have no time to play video games.

Which of the following sentences is incorrect:

  1. You should not be idle; you should do some or the other work.
  2. He is older than I.
  3. While there is life there is hope.
  4. The doctor says it is a hopeless case.

If you are allowed to use punctuations, then which of the following sequences represents the arrangement that creates an appropriate sentence:

  1. Is
  2. Right
  3. Is
  4. Whatever

If you are not allowed to use punctuations, then which of the following sequences represents the correct arrangement of the following words to create an appropriate sentence:

  1. To
  2. Let us
  3. Seek
  4. Please

Determine the number of appropriate sentences that can be created by using the following phrases:

  1. I will
  2. How he
  3. Got there
  4. Never know

You are required to check whether the following sentence is correct. If it is correct, then which of these constructs is used:

His nose was long, his fingers short

a.option: Yes, it uses single verb for two subjects
Yes, it uses a verbless subject
Yes, it uses a subjectless verb

q: Which of the following words can be used both as an adjective and adverb?
Which of the following types of adjectives cannot be used in the comparative or superlative degree?

If you must use the develop word to complete the following sentence, which of these forms of adjectives is suitable to use:

The IT industry in New York is not so __________________ as in Los Angeles.

Identify the appositive adjective in the following sentence:

The old man has a beautiful and smart daughter of marriageable age.

Identify the prepositional phrase in the following sentence:

If you do not know me by now, you probably never will.

Which of the following prepositional phrase must be used in the following sentence:

You can use the bucket _________ to draw water from the well.

Which of these conjunctions must be used in the following sentence:

He speaks __________ his father does.
Which of the following sentences contains an incorrect article usage?

Which of these statements represents the correct indirect form of the following sentence:

She said, "He has finished his lecture"

a.option: She said that he has finished his lecture
She said that he had finished his lecture
She had said that he has finished his lecture
She had said that he had finished his lecture

q:
Which of these types of pronouns is missing in the following statement:

He has a valor would carry us through everything.

Which of these statements represents the appearance of an adjective and currently being used as an adverb in the following sentence:

The children will miss many wonderful places they visited during this amazing trip.

a.option: The children will miss many places they visited wonderfully from this amazing trip.
The children will miss many wonderful places they visited in this trip which went amazingly well.
The children will miss many wonderful places from this amazingly trip.
Many places that the children visited wonderfully in this amazing trip will be missed.

q:
Write the adverbial and principal clause separately of the following sentence: 

When I was an architect I lived to please.

a.option: When I was an architect; I lived to please.
When I was an architect, I lived to please.
I lived to please, when I was an architect.

q:
Which of these sentences represents the correct punctuated form of the following statement:

He was an engineer she a doctor.

a.option: He was an engineer, she a doctor.
He was an engineer, she, a doctor.
He was an engineer; she a doctor.
He was an engineer; she, a doctor.

q:
Determine the number of punctuation mistakes in the following sentence:

How many doctors recommendations do its conditions require?

Which of these sentences represents the correct punctuation in the following statement:

They came and saw us.

Diana's office is 2 km away from her house. There is a lot of traffic on the road. Hence, she prefers a bicycle all the time over any other means of transport. Which of the following sentences describes this situation correctly:

  1. Diana always goes to her office by bicycle because of the heavy traffic.
  2. Diana always goes by bicycle to her office because of heavy traffic.

Which of the following sentences follow the correct word order:

  1. The teacher wrote an example on the blackboard yesterday.
  2. The dog ate the stake this morning in the kitchen
  3. The train is leaving for Boston tomorrow

Based on the question that has been asked by John, which of the following answers by Sam is grammatically correct:

John: "Is she going to the concert tonight?"

a.option: Sam: "No. She has already seen it."
Sam: "No. She had already seen it."

q:
Which of these prepositions is suitable to use in the following sentence:

He studied English ______ university.

How many prepositional phrases in the following sentence:

The man in the Red suit is looking for his bag.

You are given the following statement:

  1. She saw the snake.
  2. She got afraid

If conjunction is used between the statements, then which of these is correct?

a.option: She saw the snake, so she got afraid
She saw the snake or she got afraid
She saw the snake and she got afraid
She saw the snake yet she got afraid

q:
Which of these articles is suitable to use in the following statements:

  1. 1. I left _____ work at the stroke of midnight.
  2. 2. Are you at _______ home?

Which of the following is the correct article to signify that John had a small number of pens and he gave away all of them:

John gave away ______ few pens that he had.

Which of these articles is suitable to use for the following statement:

  1. Dr. Alex visits schools and universities to educate the students about ______AIDS.
  2. Dr. Alex visits schools and universities to educate the students about ______ flu.

Which of these is the most appropriate indirect speech of the following sentence:

The spectators said, “Bravo! Nice shot, Jerry!”

a.option: The spectators applauded Jerry saying that his shot was nice.
The spectators applauded Jerry for his nice shot.
The spectators applauded Jerry and said that the shot was nice.
The spectators said that the shot was nice.

q:
Which of these is the most appropriate indirect speech format of the following sentence:

Joshua said, "Let us go out for a tennis game, Rick."

a.option: Joshua suggested Rick that they should go out for a tennis game
Joshua suggested Rick to go out for a tennis game
Joshua told to go out for a Tennis game to Rick

q: You are given various versions of a sentence that contains differences in punctuation. Which of the following represents the correct meaning that the writer wants to convey?

a.option: Did you know, what the problem was with the weather? There are several theories, a few of which I would like to discuss with you.
Did you know, what the problem was with the weather? There are several theories a few of which I would like to discuss with you.
Did you know? What the problem was with the weather? There are several theories, a few of which I would like to discuss with you.
Did you know what the problem was with the weather? There are several theories, a few of which I would like to discuss with you.

q:
You are given the following sentence:

A a bad day today. The blame is B. Did you see C schedule?

In this sentence, A represents It's, B represents your's, and C represents it's. Among A, B, and C, which of the following depicts the incorrect usage of apostrophes in the sentence?

Slumdog Millionaire,' according to Professor Jared, 'is the best Hollywood movie of all time', and as Mr. Dough said, 'correctly represents the state of India in the recent past'.

What is the reason for the sentence to be incorrect if it is incorrect at all?

a.option: Structure of the sentence is incorrect

q:
What is the correct answer be to the following question:

Are you coming to the party with us?
Which of the following sentences will you use to inform students that they need not come to school on a specific day because it is a holiday?

a.option: Students needn't come to school today as it is a public holiday
Students don't need to come to school today because it is a public holiday
Students will not come to school today as it is a public holiday
Students won't come to school today because it is a public holiday

q: In which of the following sentences has the pronoun been used correctly?

a.option: He and I finished the food in the evening
He and me  finished the food in the evening
Him and I  finished the food in the evening
Him and me  finished the food in the evening

q:
What does they refer to in the following sentence:

I stopped at all the stores on my way and asked if they sold helmets but all the storekeepers told me that helmets are out of stock.

What is the error in the following sentence:

Let she who has created the largest cake, let her eat

a.option: There is nothing wrong with it.
The verb does not agree with the subject.

q:
How many mistakes are made in the given sentence with respect to the usage of articles?

"I was an United States marine. We had to use an LCD display to see the stats of a ship."

Use the correct article in the given sentence.

" Between Jason and Jordan, the latter is ______ better athlete. "

a.option: X ( X stands for zero article )

q:
Select the incorrect part of the following sentence:

S. No. Part of the sentence
1 This is
2 a six-months
3 course

Select the incorrect part of the following sentence:

S. No. 1 2 3 4
Part of the sentence It was a small party last night, we were 9 people.
If I do this, I will be happy. ______________________?

Which of these is the active form of the following sentence:

“The company website is updated frequently”.

a.option: We update the company website frequently.
People update the company website frequently.
The website is being updated by us frequently.

q:
Which of the part of the given sentence is incorrect:

1 2 3
This is a sight worth seeing.

Where should you insert the only word in the following sentence to make it appropriate:

She worked two problems
Which of the following articles must be used with an adjective in the superlative degree to make it a definitive adjective?

Which of these words is suitable to use in the following sentence:

No sooner had they returned ________ they dispersed.

Which of the following sentences is considered appropriate in regular speech:

  1. Between she and I things are not so great
  2. Between her and I, things are not so great
  3. Between her and me, things are not so great

You have been working for the last two hours. Your friend calls you and asks if you have listened to the new song of Linkin Park. You do not want to talk. Also, you do not want to be harsh to your friend.

Which of the following sentences can be appropriate to end the conversation?

a.option: Yes, it is good. I will go to bed anyways as I am tired.
Yes, it is good. Anyways, I am tired. I was working for sometime and will sleep now.
Yes. It is good but I am going to sleep now. I worked for long.
Yes, it is good. Anyway, I will go to bed now as I have been working for long and I am tired.

q:
Identify the mistake in the following sentence:

The teacher wrote an example yesterday on the blackboard.

a.option: 'Yesterday on the blackboard' should come before 'wrote an example'

q:
Which of these agreements of the verb is suitable to use with the subject of this sentence:

Which side ____ winning?

Which of these forms of verbs is suitable to use in the following sentence:

I would like to _____ a bath.

Which of these adverbs is suitable to use in the following sentence:

I felt _____ about not doing ______ in the final game of the tournament.

Which of the following statements are correct:

  1. The water is too cold.
  2. The water is very cold
  3. The water is really cold

Which of these words are suitable to use in the following sentence:

You should fulfill the monetary requirements ________. We deal ________ on credits.

Which of these prepositions is suitable to use in the following sentence:

He skipped school today _______ a severe leg injury

Which of these prepositions is suitable to use in the following sentence:

With his new camera, he is able to take a clear picture _______ 100 feet away.

Which of these articles is suitable to use for the following statement:

Alice had ______ sore throat. _____ sore throat made it hard to talk.

Which of these articles is suitable for the following statements:

  1. The troops need to head to ______ north.
  2. The troops need to head ______ north.

Which of these is the correct reported speech for the following statement:

Jeremy said, "Please open the door."

a.option: Jeremy requested me to open the door
Jeremy ordered me to open the door
Jeremy requested that me open the door

q:
Which pronouns will you use to complete the following sentences:

  1. ______ boys drink our tea hot.
  2. They call ______ chokers.
Choose the sentence where the word order is correct.

a.option: I would have recommended never to that if I had any idea.
I would have recommended to that never if I had an idea.
I would never have recommended that if I had an idea
If I had an idea, never would I have recommended that.

q:
Select the correct option:

Do not __________________ your cell phone.

Select the correct option:

Yesterday, I received _____________ letter; __________ letter contained 3 orange pips.

The given sentence is broken into five parts. Rearrange the parts of the sentence into a meaningful sentence:

  1. The chronic
  2. dark circles and fine lines
  3. lackluster skin,
  4. loss of sleep
  5. can lead to
He often receives ____________________ on his paintings. His paintings_______________________ any decor.

Select the correct option:

John is a friend and _______________________________ of both Bob and Tara.

Which of these is the incorrect word in the following sentence:

S. No. 1 2 3 4
Parts of the sentence Gardening is a good hobby that helps reveal stress

Select the correct option:

The word stationary refers to _______________.

a.option: Something which belongs to a station

q:
Choose the correct option to complete the following sentence:

My friend’s opinion did not ______________________ my decision to take up the test.

Select the correct option:

_____________ turn is it to drive and ____________ driving tomorrow?

Select the correct option:

I have not responded to her ______________________________ yet.
Which of the following is an antonym of the word candid?

Select the correct option:

In a family get together, each of the guests ____________________ introduced to the newly married bride.

Select the correct option:

If you remember to do your _____________________ chores ______________________, your mother will appreciate you.

Which of these sentences represent the correct indirect form of the following statement:

He said, "I must do this. It may be the only way."

a.option: He said that he must do this and that it may be the only way.
He said that he must do this and that it may be the only way.
He said that he had to do this and that it was be the only way.
He said that he had to do this and that it might be the only way.

q:
Which of these statements represents the appropriate form of the following sentence:

Rob and me are good friends and we used to study in the same class in fifth standard.

a.option: Rob and me are good friends, and were classmates in fifth standard.
Rob and I are good friends and classmates since fifth standard.
Rob and me are good friends, and classmates from fifth standard.
Rob and I are good friends, and were classmates the in fifth standard.

q:
Which of these sentences represents the correct punctuation in the following statement:

Nobody ever doubted that he would succeed in his endeavours.

a.option: That he would succeed, in his endeavours nobody ever doubted
That he would succeed; in his endeavours, nobody ever doubted
That he would succeed in his endeavours, nobody ever doubted

q:
Rearrange the following set of words to make a grammatically correct sentence.

  1. The criminal
  2. In the legs
  3. Shot
  4. The old lady
  5. Before hiding

If the root word that must be used is correct, then which of these adjectives and adverbs is suitable to use in the following sentence: 

He ________ defined the terminology. The definition was sounded ________.

Which of these options will you use to make the following sentence past conditional:

If I ______ better in the practice sessions, I ______ a better grade in the final examination.

What is the meaning of the idiom in the following sentence:

“I do what I like”, she said, and - just to drive home the point - she threw her books aside.

The following paragraph consists of six sentences.The first and sixth sentences are given and the four sentences in between, which are labeled as P, Q, R, and S, are jumbled. What is the correct order of these four sentences such that there is a logical flow from sentence 1 to 6?

Sentence 1: At an early age of 20, Samuel Smiles graduated in medicine at Edinburgh University.

P: He wrote biographies of George Stephenson and many others.

Q: He practiced first in his native town, Haddington and then in Leeds.

R: His bent for literature made him abandon medicine.

S: His first post of editorship was at The Leeds Times.

Sentence 6: But his fame today rests on the series of books he wrote on character building, namely Self-Help, Character, Thrift, and Duty.

What is the meaning of the idiom in the following sentence:

Our company is growing rapidly. Let me paint a picture by sharing some data.

a.option: To explain something in a great detail
